text:
e="preserve">Thompson Falls is a city in Montana in the United States. It is the county seat of Sanders County. As of the 2010 United States Census, there were 1,313 people.
Thompson Falls was named after British explorer, geographer and fur trader David Thompson. He founded a North West Company fur trading post. The town is next to natural waterfalls on the Clark Fork river.
Thompson Falls was established in 1910.
